required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ameliorating the Obstacle of Pap Smear
clinical_study.official_title: Ameliorating the Obstacle of Pap Smear: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To reduce the procedural pain of Pap smear, this study expects to apply the peak-end rule to Pap smear by prolonging the insertion of speculum after samples are obtained from the cervix. This study aims to conduct a randomized controlled study at National Taiwan University Hospital (NTUH). The investigators expect to compare the recalled pain intensity of the intervention and control groups.

detailed_description.textblock: Purpose: In order to reduce the procedural pain, this study expects to apply the peak-end rule to Pap smear by prolonging the insertion of speculum after samples are obtained from the cervix. Methods: This study aims to conduct a randomized controlled study at National Taiwan University Hospital (NTUH). Approximately 200 subjects will be recruited. The investigators will utilize the peak-end rule by adding a non-painful event after the most uncomfortable phase in the intervention group. All study subjects are requested to score on a numeric pain scale every 20 seconds during and right after the procedure.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects are divided into two groups, one with traditional Pap smear and one with Pap smear adding a non-painful procedure at the end. The investigators will compare the real-time pain score and recalled pain to check whether the theory works.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will not know their grouping and operator will not know the grouping until the last second.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure will be the recalled pain intensity during the smear examination. Pain will also be assessed by using a 0-10 numerical pain scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects' willing to receive further Pap tests
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will contact the subjects on phone 3 months after the examination to ask whether they are willing to undergo another Pap smear in the next year and in the next 3 years or not. A questionnaire will be used to grade the willingness.

arm_group.description: Adding a non-painful event after the most uncomfortable phase of Pap smear.

intervention.description: Adding a non-painful event after the most uncomfortable phase of Pap smear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Biological female
- Aged 30-70
- Provision of written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of pelvic or vaginal surgery, active infectious gynecologic complaint, prior intervention for abnormal cervical cytology
- Incapable of understanding the numeric pain scale
- Incapable of communicating in Chinese, English or Taiwanese
- Prior cervical cancer diagnosis
- Prior hysterectomy
- Pregnant women
- Those who use painkillers within 24 hours of this project
